notesStmt.note: Imperfect at the end. A number of pages partially damaged (restored on modern paper); large signs of worming. There are lacunae after folio 1 and 2.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A Judeo-Arabic commentary on the Hafṭarot of Numbers.

collation.p: 12 quires of mostly 10 leaves. Quires signed originally with Arabic words on the first page and with Hebrew letters on the last page; most of the signatures are now lost.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental square and semi-cursive script, unpunctuated, of 15th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Hafṭaroth with Commentary. Hebrew & Arabic. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2584.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 08 July 1882, folio [131v].
